item.description:
Here's an event for art fans in late October: a sculpture tour in a cemetery! Forest Hills Cemetery in Jamaica Plain is historic. The Forest Hills Educational Trust opened the Contemporary Sculpture Path in 2001, establishing one of Bostonâ€™s most ambitious collections of temporary and permanent public art. On Sunday October 24 they are having a "10th Anniversary Celebration of The Contemporary Sculpture Path." There are events from 1:00-5:00, but this meet-up is specifically for the 3:00pm flute concert (Bach and Debussy) and the 3:30pm tour of the sculpture path with some of the participating artists.

Important: I'll be at the main front gate of the cemetery by 2:45. I'm tall, look like my photo, and will have a Meet-up sign of some kind. A little before 3pm, we'll stroll to where the concert will be held. If you get there later, find the flute concert before it ends. Since this is a guided tour that starts at 3:30, we won't wait for stragglers, so be there or be square! (After RSVPs close, I'll send out my cell phone # to those who RSVP 'yes' and 'maybe.')

Here's a page with details of the full afternoon events (scroll down for the Oct. 24 listing).
http://www.foresthill...

Directions to Forest Hills Cemetery:
http://www.foresthill...

If anyone is interested in getting a bite and/or drink afterwards to talk about art, spirituality, and Halloween (or whatever), there's a number of fine spots in Jamaica Plain.
item.how_to_find_us: Main front gate (see listing below for more info)
item.name: Contemporary Scultpture Tour in a Cemetery
